item.title: Code Navigation in Emacs
item.description: When working with Python code bases, i sometimes have the need to jump between next / previous functions i am working on within the same file. As this is a common thing i would do, i tried searching for way to navigate to previous and next functions relative to my current position. There are a collection of tools that make this easy for you: imenu With imenu, you are able to call =M-x imenu= or as it's bound to =C-x C-j= which will show the list of available imenu candidates and make you select one you'd like to jump to.

item.title: Setup Emacs for Python development using Pyenv
item.description: Pyenv, as advertised, is a tool that lets you work with multiple versions of Python on the same machine. You could install different versions of Python such as 2.7.12 or 3.5.2 and define which one you'd like to use by executing: > pyenv install 3.5.2 > cd /path/i/want/to/use/3.5.2/in > pyenv local 3.5.2 > python -V That would compile and install 3.5.2 on your machine and have it available wherever you'd like to use it.

item.title: About
item.description: I am Rakan Al-Hneiti. A software developer from Amman / Jordan currently based in Berlin / Germany. In this blog post i'll mostly be be writing about Python / Django and Emacs among other programming experiments or side projects i might be doing for fun. I hope you enjoy those blog posts!

item.title: Projects
item.description: Python Django Pushy: Python / Django app that provides push notifications functionality with celery. The main purpose of this app is to help you send push notifications to your users at scale. If you have lots of registered device keys, django-pushy will split your keys into smaller groups which run in parallel making the process of sending notifications faster. Pocket CLI: Pocket-CLI is an application for reading / listing and managing your GetPocket.
